metadata.title: CVE-2023-4015 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's netfilter: nf_tablescomponent can be exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. On anerror when building a nftables rule, deactivating immediate expressions innft_immediate_deactivate() can lead unbinding the chain and objects bedeactivated but later used. We recommend upgrading past commit0a771f7b266b02d262900c75f1e175c7fe76fec2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4015` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-5-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1005-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required

linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-5.5.1').
